albumSearchPrompt: Sua tarefa é retornar metadados completos de um álbum dado o termo de busca a seguir. Input: {{albumQuery}}. Descreva o álbum em JSON válido com campos: id, artist, title, year, cover (URL), tracks (array com id, rank, title, duration em segundos).
rankingPrompt:
##RANKING PROMPT: What are the most acclaimed tracks and the ranking for all tracks of the albums {{albumTitle}} by {{albumArtist}} ({{albumYear}}) considering the https://www.besteveralbums.com/ ratings?

##RULES
- Primary evidence: use BestEverAlbums ratings when the album exists there. If BestEverAlbums provides per-track ratings or a track-ranking, use its ordering. If only album-level ratings are available, use them as supporting evidence.
- Fallback: if the album is not found on BestEverAlbums, consolidate using other reliable sources (prefer those in `defaultRankingProviders`).
- Sources: include BestEverAlbums as a `sources` entry with `provider` "BestEverAlbums", `providerType` "community" and `referenceUrl` set to the BestEverAlbums album URL when available; include up to 3 additional sources if used.
- Anti-hallucination: do NOT invent URLs. If you cannot verify a URL, set `referenceUrl` to null.
- Output constraints: temperature 0; keep output compact and machine-parsable.

##RESPONSE FORMAT (REQUIRED)
Return ONLY these two parts in this exact order and with no extra commentary:
1) A compact JSON object (single code block) matching the structure below:
{
  "ranking": [
    {"trackTitle": "...", "position": 1, "evidence": [{"provider": "BestEverAlbums", "referenceUrl": "https://..."}]},
    ...
  ],
  "sources": [
    {"provider": "BestEverAlbums", "providerType": "community", "referenceUrl": "https://..."},
    ...
  ]
}
2) A compact numbered plain-text list (one track per line) matching the `ranking` order, for example:
1. Track Title — [BestEverAlbums](https://... )
2. Another Track — [BestEverAlbums](https://... )
3. ...

No additional text, explanation or metadata outside the JSON block and the numbered list.
